page.title: 09Dairy Farming in Felton Area
page.content: There is a strong representation of dairying in this area. There are seven herds ranging from two very large units (one of over 300 cows) to six cows on a small holding. Apart from one herd of Ayreshires, black and white cattle (Holstein and Friesians) are the predominant breed. Milk goes to a local dairy producing concentrated crumb for a chocolate factory, and is collected daily by tanker. The cows are summer grazed and are fed on silage in winter. Only a small amount of hay is made. Concentrated cattle cake is fed according to milk yield. Most cattle are winter housed in cubicles, with some in covered yards. The larger herds are milked in herring-bone parlours. Most herds are milked twice daily, but one herd is milked three times.
